concept.definition: Indicates a barline in the context of a measure or possibly intrameasure separator.
Attribute of a barline in which it connects to the top of the staff immediately below.
Single thin vertical line through staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.
Thick vertical line through staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.
Double thin vertical line through staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.
Inverse of final barline through staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.
Double thick vertical line through staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.
Two-space high line through middle of staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.
Tick at top of staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.
Dashed vertical line through staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff. In the alternate design, a dotted vertical line is used instead.
Dashed vertical line through staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff. In the alternate design, a dashed vertical line is used instead.
Thin-thick line through staff. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.
Thin-thick line through staff with two dots to the left on the middle spaces. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.
Thick-thin line through staff with two dots to the right on the middle spaces. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff.

Thin-thick-thin line with a pair of dots on each side. If a through barline, line connects to top of next staff. Indicates an end repeat barline and a begin repeat barline back to back. In the alternate design, a thick-thick line with a pair of dots on each side is used instead.
